conclusion: Apply principles of mechanics, Newton's laws, and concept of friction.
Identify forces: applied force F and frictional force on each block.
Spring compresses when block B accelerates, exerting opposing force on block C.
Net force on each block must be the same since they accelerate together.
Using Newton's second law, frictional force on block D equals sum of frictional forces on blocks B and C.
Frictional force on block D equals frictional force on block C.
Magnitude of static friction force on block D equals magnitude of frictional force on block C.
